revised_title: Industrial Quality and Productivity with Statistical Methods: General Discussion
tldr: This article discusses the importance of using statistical methods for industrial quality and productivity. It highlights the need for cross-disciplinary cooperation and the use of modern computing methods to improve the design and analysis of experiments. The authors also emphasize the importance of adapting to new attitudes and methods, such as the Japanese top-down, company-wide, total quality approach, to succeed in the industry.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Industrial and Organizational Psychology
